description: Test to check the behaviour of a Server that tries to connect with itself thinking it is a remote server.
The expected behaviour is to nothing happens, the Server will acked itself and its change is already in the Database.
Server B connects with Server A. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration
Server A connects with Server B. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration
It requires more time than usual in order to announce Server A DATA(P) and receive it and reply in B
Server B connects with Server A. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration
Server A connects with Server B. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration
Server B connects with server A. Server B leaves. Server B start again. Server A leaves, Server A start again
Both Servers should know every information from the other before leaving and after restarting
t = 0  : A1 starts & B1 starts
t = 2  : A1 snapshot
t = 3  : B1 snapshot & B1 finish
t = 7  : A1 snapshot
t = 8  : B2 starts
t = 12 : B2 snapshot
t = 13 : A1 snapshot & A1 finish
t = 17 : B2 snapshot
t = 18 : A2 starts
t = 22 : A2 snapshot
t = 23 : B2 snapshot & B2 finish
t = 27 : A2 snapshot & A2 finish
Client connects with Server. Server leaves. Server turns back with same configuration.
Test to check the consequences of modifying the file referenced by FASTDDS_ENVIRONMENT_FILE on the
Discovery Server behaviour. SERVER and SIMPLE participants will change their discovery information
aligned with the changes introduced in the environment file
Test that when a process stops, all DATA(Up) of all Participants in it are sent
Test that two clients with EASY_MODE discovery are able to communicate between themselfs.
The server is automatically instantiated using the Fast DDS CLI tool call from Fast DDS.
Test that two clients with EASY_MODE discovery are able to communicate between themselfs.
The server is instantiated using the Fast DDS CLI tool with the keyword 'auto'.
The Domain ID is specified using the ROS_DOMAIN_ID environment variable.
The EASY_MODE cannot be properly tested in this repo because it is meant for connecting
different hosts, and the tests are run in the same host. Only its correct parsing and
server creation is tested here.
Test that two servers are able to discover each other and exchange data using the 'ROS_STATIC_PEERS'
environment variable.
Test that two servers are able to discover each other using the 'start' keyword.
Test that two servers are able to discover each other using the 'add' keyword.
This test verifies:
1. The 'add' keyword accepts list of locators
2. The 'set' keyword replaces the list of remote servers (single server)
3. The 'stop' keyword stops a server and it is undiscovered by the other servers
This test verifies that 'stop' without '-d' stops all running servers.
Server B connects with Server A. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration

Test that a TCP discovery server with a custom GUID (-i CLI param) and listening on any (0.0.0.0)
is able to communicate with a client that connects to localhost (127.0.0.1).
This test is a regression from #22006
Test that Fast DDS CLI supports the creation of servers using TCPv4 transport
Test that Fast DDS CLI supports the creation of servers using TCPv6 transport
Test that TCPv4 transport is supported by the environment variable
Test that TCPv6 transport is supported by the environment variable
